result.execSummary:
The defendant Tyrone D Patterson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Tyrone D Patterson is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Tyrone D Patterson was found guilty of Trafficking of a Child, a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.051(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: Obtain GED.  Seek and maintain employment.

No violations of criminal law rising to the level of probable cause.
No contact with R.B. dob 7/24/98.

supervisions.notes:
Defendant to provide a biological specimen for DNA analysis/DNA sample.
Court advised defendant he cannot possess firearms;  and cannot vote until his civil rights are restored.
Defendant must comply with the sex offender registry for 15 years.  Cannot work or volunteer with children under 16 years.

Fine of $1,000.00 plus mandatory costs, assessments and surcharges, DNA surcharge.  DOC to collect moentary amounts at the rate of 25% of prison funds.
Balance to be paid as condition of Extended Supervision.  To be paid by end of the sentence or civil judgment to be entered against the defendant and subject to other collection.
*Restitution set at zero.

Provide a DNA sample unless previously done, pay DNA surcharge.
Pay DNA surcharge, balance of all applicable court costs, fees and surcharges.  To be paid through collection by DOC from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of Extended Supervision.  DOC shall collect those sums.
Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
Defendant is to receive credit for any paymetns made towards the court costs, fees, surcharges and DNA surcharge.

Court administratively  ordered the previous sentence vacated.  Defendant resentenced on 11/3/2016.
Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program if deemed appropriate by Wisconsin Department of Corrections.

superMiscConds.notes: Comply with the standard rules of Extended Supervision.
Cooperate and participate with an AODA assessment.  Follow any recommended treatment.  Maintain absolute sobriety.  Submit to random urine screens.

supervisions.notes: Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor; also advised that his voting rights are suspended and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Tyrone D Patterson

FILED:
- Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief.
- Pretrial Incarceration Credit form.

Defendant Tyrone D Patterson in court with attorney Mark S Rosen.  Defendant Tyrone D Patterson in custody.  Erin Michelle Karshen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Matter in court for Post-Judgment Re-Sentencing Hearing.

**Court "administratively" ordered the previous sentence VACATED.

Sentencing proceeds. Statements made by the State, defense and defendant. Additional statements made by defendant's mother, Mary L.

AS TO COUNT 2:  The Court sentenced defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons for 20 YEARS.  
INITIAL CONFINEMENT of 10 YEARS and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 10 YEARS.
Credit given for 621 days time served.

Court finds defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program, IF DEEMED APPROPRIATE BY WISCONSIN DEPARTMENT OF CORRECTIONS.
Court finds defendant is eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program, IF DEEMED APPROPRIATE BY WISCONSIN DEPARTMENT OF CORRECTIONS.

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION (AS TO COUNT 2):
* Comply with the standard rules of extended supervision.
* No contact with the victim.
* Cooperate and participate with an AODA assessment and follow any recommended treatment.
* Maintain absolute sobriety and submit to random urine screens.
* PAY the balance of all applicable court costs, fees, and surcharges.   The Court ordered that all court costs, fees, and surcharges be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
* Provide a DNA sample (unless previously done) and PAY DNA surcharge.  The Court ordered that the DNA  surcharge be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.

OTHER COURT ORDERS:
* Defendant is to receive credit for any payments made towards the court costs, fees, surcharges, and DNA surcharge.

  
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor.  
Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.
Appeal rights given.

  Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.

Court examined defendant and finds that the defendant willingly, voluntarily, and intelligently withdrew his motion to withdraw the plea.
The original plea stands as previously set forth on the record on 05-18-2015.

Court ACCEPTS stipulation and scheduled this matter for a Re-Sentencing Hearing.

After discussion with Judge Konkol, informed Tom Salter that court will not amend judgment by removing the 15 years for sex offender registration.  BY STATUTE, the 15 years does not start until discharge of sentence, so there is no other way to interpret the sentencing comments.  It is by law.  No action taken on agent's request.  jbs

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Tyrone D Patterson in court with attorney Kevin Michael Gaertner.  Defendant Tyrone D Patterson in custody.  Erin M. Karshen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Sentencing proceeds.  State has complied with victim notification.  Statements by counsel, Mary L. and defendant. COURT ADVISES the defendant he cannot possess firearms; he must provide a DNA sample;  pay the mandatory DNA surcharge; defendant must comply with the sex offender registry for 15 years; defendant cannot work or volunteer with children under 16 years and cannot vote until his civil rights are restored.  

Court 2: COURT ORDERS defendant to serve a term in the Wisconsin State Prison system - TOTAL LENGTH OF SENTENCE - 30 years with 96 days credit -  INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT - 20 years  -  EXTENDED SUPERVISION - 10 years; pay a fine of $1,000 plus mandatory costs, assessments and surcharges by the end of the sentence or a civil judgment is to be entered against the defendant and subject to other collection.  

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:  1) no violations of criminal law rising to the level of probable cause; 2) pay any monetary amounts ordered but not paid while in the institution; 3) no contact with RB )DOB: 7-24-98); 4) sex offender treatment as recommended; 5) obtain GED; 6) seek and maintain employment.

Court finds defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program or the Substance Abuse Program.

COURT ORDERS:
-  defendant to provide a biological specimen for DNA analysis;
-  DOC to collect monetary sums/amounts at the rate of 25% of prison funds;
- restitution set -0-.

Appeal rights given.  Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence and Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief and Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgment received and filed.  Copies given to the defendant.

Defendant Tyrone D Patterson in court with attorney Kevin Michael Gaertner.  Defendant Tyrone D Patterson in custody.  Erin M. Karshen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Defendant waives constitutional rights, enters a plea of GUILTY to Count 2 and is examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum  received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the Complaint as a factual basis for judgment.  Court finds defendant guilty as charged Count 2 in the Information and enters a judgment of conviction.

On motion of the State, Court orders Count 1 DISMISSED. 

Parties advised the Court will listen to statements by counsel, victim, a friend or relative of the defendant and defendant.  Any other statements must be in writing and provided to the Court 72 hours in advance of sentencing.  Restitution will be addressed at that time.

Court orders defendant remanded into the custody of the sheriff pending sentencing.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for May 28, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Court questions defendant as to all offers conveyed to him by the State.  Defendant states he doesn't know what he wants to do and would like to speak with his attorney.  Case passed.
